triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper uses formal verification techniques to prove correctness of probabilistic algorithms with mathematical rigor.

triples.name: Randomized algorithm
triples.relevance: Probabilistic algorithms are the primary subject being formally verified in the thesis.

triples.name: Proof assistant
triples.relevance: The paper uses a mechanical theorem prover (proof assistant) to formalize and verify the probabilistic algorithms.

triples.name: Measure (mathematics)
triples.relevance: Measure theory provides the mathematical foundation for formalizing probability spaces and probabilistic reasoning.

triples.name: Probability space
triples.relevance: Probability spaces model the random bit generator and provide the formal basis for probabilistic specifications.

triples.name: Bernoulli distribution
triples.relevance: The random bit generator is modeled as IID Bernoulli(1/2) random variables representing coin flips.

triples.name: Monad (functional programming)
triples.relevance: State-transformer monads are used to model probabilistic programs and manage the random bit generator in functional programming.

triples.name: Primality test
triples.relevance: The Miller-Rabin primality test (a well-known probabilistic algorithm) is formally verified in the thesis.

triples.name: Random walk
triples.relevance: The symmetric simple random walk is presented as an example probabilistic program that is formally verified.

triples.name: Reservoir sampling
triples.relevance: Sampling algorithms for various probability distributions are formally verified as examples in the framework.

triples.name: Loop invariant
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new formal technique for reducing properties of probabilistic while loops to properties of terminating programs using loop invariants.

triples.name: Higher-order logic
triples.relevance: The paper develops an extensive foundational formalization using higher-order logic for probability, creating new formalizations of measure theory.
